body:
This looks good, r+. Thanks for trying to keep everything consistent, even we haven't done a good job with that in the past. This can merge after CI passes. (Anyone can do that, but I'll try and keep an eye on it).

PS: The review jargon is `r?`, `r-`, and `r+`. The etymology is that Bugzilla has flags, and one of the flags is "review". You can be "review?" (pending), "review-" (rejected) or "review+" (approved). Then these are shortened to just `/r[?+-]/`. There are other flags like "feedback" (f?, f+, f-) for advice that doesn't care approval.

Given that, "r+?" is a bit silly. Though in practice we mostly just use the Github assignee/review approval stuff nowadays.
